meanings.definition: Refuse to acknowledge or accept responsibility for something.
meanings.sent1: She decided to disavow any involvement in the prank.
meanings.sent2: He always tries to disavow his mistakes instead of learning from them.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to disavow knocking over the vase by looking innocent.
meanings.sent4: The politician's attempt to disavow the scandal only made it worse.
meanings.sent5: The student's attempt to disavow cheating was met with skepticism by the teacher.

meanings.definition: Deny any connection or support for something.
meanings.sent1: The company had to disavow the fake endorsements on their products.
meanings.sent2: She had to disavow her previous statements after new evidence emerged.
meanings.sent3: The dog tried to disavow the mess in the living room by wagging its tail.
meanings.sent4: The celebrity's publicist had to disavow the controversial tweet on their behalf.
meanings.sent5: The athlete had to disavow the use of performance-enhancing drugs to maintain their reputation.
